channel.description: Recent content in 538 on favstats - personal blog

item.title: 538 Predictions for the 2018 Midterm Elections
item.description: Packages # Install these packages if you don't have them yet # if (!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman") # devtools::install_github("favstats/tidytemplate") pacman::p_load(tidyverse, tidytemplate, janitor, ggthemes, ggpubr, rvest, ggrepel) Load Data csv_link <- "https://blogs.sciencemag.org/sciencehound/wp-content/uploads/sites/5/2018/11/Congressional-election-results-and-forecasts.csv" pred_dat <- read_csv(csv_link) %>% clean_names() %>% mutate(close = ifelse(election_results <= 55 & election_results >= 45, "Close", "Safe")) %>% left_join(tibble(state = state.name, abbr =state.abb)) %>% mutate(distr_abbr = paste0(abbr, district)) pred_dat ## # A tibble: 435 x 14 ## state district democratic_cand~ republican_cand~ election_results ## <chr> <int> <chr> <chr> <dbl> ## 1 Alab~ 1 Kennedy Byrne 36.
